# Rabies Incidence  
  
Rabies incidence has been estimated through exhaustive contact tracing in Serengeti District since 2002. Contact tracing involves identifying probable animal rabies cases and human rabies exposures, through interviews with witnesses and contacts. A brain tissue sample is also taken from the animal if located, for subsequent testing: a rapid diagnostic kit is used in-situ, with laboratory confirmation and whole genome sequencing completed later.  
  
Scroll down to see rabies incidence over time, including maps of probable and lab-confirmed animal rabies cases, as well as probable human rabies exposures and deaths.

```{r, echo=FALSE, include=FALSE, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE}
script_district = "Serengeti"
```


```{r, echo=FALSE, warning=FALSE, message=FALSE}
# Set plot params
start_date_1 <- "2001-12-31"
start_month_1 <- 1
start_date_2 <- "2011-12-31"
diff_in_days = difftime(strptime(start_date_2, format = "%Y-%m-%d"), strptime(start_date_1, format = "%Y-%m-%d"), units = "days")
start_month_2 <- (floor(as.double(diff_in_days)/365))*12 
end_date <- Sys.Date()

# Find maximum number of bitten animals/bite victims for y-axis for each district
y_axis_max_2002 <- find_y_max(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month, start_month=start_month_1, type="epi")
y_axis_max_2012 <- find_y_max(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month, start_month=start_month_2, type="epi")
```

### Comparison of exposures and cases {.tabset .tabset-pills}  
  
#### 2002 to present
``` {r, echo=FALSE}
epi_plot(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month,
         district=script_district, start_date=start_date_1, start_month=start_month_1,
         
         end_date=end_date, max_y=y_axis_max_2002)
```

#### 2012 to present
``` {r, echo=FALSE}
epi_plot(human_dataframe=human_epi_month, animal_dataframe=animal_epi_month, 
         district=script_district, start_date=start_date_2, start_month=start_month_2,
         end_date=end_date, max_y=y_axis_max_2012)
```

### Summary

### Location of animal Rabies cases  
  
The map below shows the location of probable and lab-confirmed animal rabies cases traced in Serengeti District over the last five years.  This map excludes all bites where the rabies status is not suspect or cannot be determined; village centroids are used in the absence of coordinates. Select from the dropdown menu to view data from a specific year:  

```{r droplink, echo=FALSE}
# Create table
table_site <- c("html/ser_epi_map_2018.html", "html/ser_epi_map_2017.html",
                "html/ser_epi_map_2016.html", "html/ser_epi_map_2015.html",
                "html/ser_epi_map_2014.html")
names(table_site) <- c("2018", "2017", "2016", "2015", "2014")

bsselect(table_site, type = "iframe", frame_height=550, style="btn-primary", show_tick=TRUE, height=0)
```
